situation: P started screaming and covering his ears during a noisy school assembly.
action: The teacher aide shouted over the noise, trying to explain the assembly program to P and insisted he participate. The aide tried to keep him inside by holding his hands to stop him from leaving.
effect: P became more distressed and increased in volume, eventually escalating his distress to a meltdown. The attempt to restrain him further added to his sensory overload.
topic: Sensory Overload Situations - scenarios involving overwhelming sensory inputs like loud noises, bright lights, or crowded spaces
